threats.Description: Without appropriate access control (e.g., domain access policies or fine-grained access control) attackers or unauthorized users could read, modify, or delete data in the domain.
threats.Mitigation: Enable domain access policies and, optionally, fine-grained access control to limit user permissions and enforce IAM-based authentication.

threats.Description: If audit logs are not enabled, suspicious operations and access attempts will not be captured, complicating incident investigation and compliance checks.
threats.Mitigation: Enable audit logs for detailed tracking of user operations and events, helping to detect anomalies and unauthorized actions.

threats.Threat Name: Single Data Node or Insufficient Fault Tolerance
threats.Description: Running data nodes without fault tolerance (e.g., only one node or insufficient replica shards) could result in data loss or service downtime if a node fails.
threats.Mitigation: Configure multi-node clusters with replica shards in multiple Availability Zones to ensure high availability and prevent data loss.

threats.Source: Anyone with Access to Underlying Storage
threats.Description: Storing domain data unencrypted allows unauthorized actors with access to the physical storage to read sensitive data.
threats.Mitigation: Enable encryption at rest using AWS KMS keys to secure data and restrict key usage via IAM policies.

threats.Threat Name: HTTPS Not Required for Client Connections
threats.Description: Allowing unencrypted HTTP connections exposes data in transit to eavesdropping and tampering, compromising confidentiality and integrity.
threats.Mitigation: Require HTTPS for all connections to the OpenSearch domain to ensure end-to-end encryption of data in transit.

threats.Description: If the domain is not restricted to a VPC, unauthorized users from the internet can attempt to access or disrupt the service.
threats.Mitigation: Configure the domain to run within a VPC and restrict network access to only trusted IP ranges or resources.

threats.Description: Without streaming logs to CloudWatch, administrators lack real-time visibility into domain performance or potential security events, delaying incident response.
threats.Mitigation: Enable CloudWatch logging for domain logs to facilitate continuous monitoring, alerting, and troubleshooting.

threats.Source: Malicious Actor on the Same Network or Host
threats.Description: If node-to-node encryption is disabled, data traveling between cluster nodes in transit could be intercepted or modified by an attacker with network access.
threats.Mitigation: Enable node-to-node encryption to ensure that traffic within the cluster remains secure and cannot be intercepted or altered.
